title: ASPS Trainee Evaluation of a Training Post

pages.name: ASPS Trainee Evaluation of a Training Post

elements.name: question10
elements.html:
Instructions:

Complete all sections. De-identified aggregate scores and comments may be provided to a Hospital Post as part of the Australian Board of Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery's Accreditation process. This evaluation form may be submitted with your name (optional) or anonymously.


Disclaimer:

The following questions are asked for the purpose of collecting basic statistics as well as maintaining a training program that meet the AMC’s Standards for medical education programs. Only de-identified information will be provided to the Board of PRS. Information will be collected for several years to build up a profile for each training post.
The information collected via this form may form part of the Board’s assessment for re-accreditation processes. Should areas of concern be identified, the Board or ASPS may contact you for further information. By completing this form you consent to a member of the Board or ASPS contacting you in relation to the responses given.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Was there space for private study and access to internet or library resources?

elements.name: question2
elements.title: How often did the unit undertake audits (average)?

pages.title: Education facilities and systems

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Was there a hospital-based teaching programme?

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What was the frequency of the hospital-based teaching programme?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Was this programme of appropriate quality for your training level?

elements.name: question6
elements.title: If the teaching programme had less 1 session per week or was of an inappropriate quality, what did you perceive was the main reason?

choices.text: inappropriate timing / clash with other commitments

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Was there opportunity to undertake research?

elements.name: question8
elements.title: If your answer to the question about research opportunity was "no", what was the main reason?

choices.text: insufficient time due to clinical commitments
alternate trainee focus (eg preparation for examination)

elements.name: question9
elements.title: How often did you receive feedback from your training supervisor?

elements.name: question11
elements.title: How often did you receive feedback from other consultants?

elements.name: question12
elements.title: How did you feel the level of support was?

elements.name: question13
elements.title: How many consultant-led ward rounds per week (average)?

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Did you undertake this term as flexible training (less than full time)?

choices.text: Yes - please describe if this was a valuable learning experience with sufficient support?
No - if not a valuable learning experience, please explain

elements.name: question15
elements.title: How many clinic sessions were you involved with per week (average)?

elements.name: question16
elements.title: How many operating sessions were you involved with per week as surgeon or primary assistant (average)?

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Which choice best describes the surgical case load?

elements.name: question18
elements.title: What, if any factors, impacted on your rating for surgical case load?

choices.text: Too few junior staff (eg registrars, residents, training fellows) for the case load
Too many junior staff (eg registrars, residents, training fellows) for the case load
Time required for non-operative workload was too high

elements.name: question19
elements.title: The surgical casemix (per the Curriculum) was:

choices.text: Limited to subspecialty area (hand, breast, CMF, aesthetic, etc)
Adequate mix of areas and complexity
Good mix of areas and complexity

elements.name: question20
elements.title: On call commitment was (average, days):

elements.name: question21
elements.title: Hours of clinical work per week (average, excluding private study):

elements.name: question22
elements.title: Would you recommend the rotation as a useful training experience?

pages.name: page5

elements.name: question23
elements.title: Did the unit provide a safe training environment, promoting respect and free of discrimination andharassment? (If 'no', please explain)

elements.name: question24
elements.title: Please provide at least 1 positive comment on the unit/rotation.

elements.name: question25
elements.title: Please provide at least 1 idea on possible improvements to the training offered in the unit/rotation.

elements.name: question26
elements.title: Please document any significant concerns that you have with the unit/rotation.

elements.name: question27
elements.title: If you have documented any concerns, have they been discussed with:

choices.text: The training supervisor or unit representative
A jurisdictional representative not involved in my training

elements.name: question28
elements.title: Have you reached out to RACS for support during this rotation?

elements.name: question29
elements.title: If yes, would you like ASPS or a Board representative to contact you for a confidential discussion?

elements.name: question30
elements.html: Unless you consent to disclosure, your comments will be treated as confidential. Aggregated data may be disclosed subject to the Board's consent.

pages.title: Building and maintaining a culture of respect
